com.google.android.pinnedheader.headerlist

Class HeaderAdapter<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • android.widget.ArrayAdapter<T>
        • com.google.android.pinnedheader.headerlist.HeaderAdapter<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.Filterable, android.widget.ListAdapter, android.widget.SpinnerAdapter, PinnedHeaderListView.PinnedHeaderAdapter

    public abstract class HeaderAdapter<T>
extends android.widget.ArrayAdapter<T>
implements PinnedHeaderListView.PinnedHeaderAdapter

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  HeaderAdapter.Placement
      An item view is displayed differently depending on whether it is placed at the beginning, middle or end of a section.

      • getItemPlacementInSection

        public HeaderAdapter.Placement getItemPlacementInSection(int position)
        Computes the item's placement within its section and populates the placement object accordingly. Please note that the returned object is volatile and should be copied if the result needs to be used later.

      • configurePinnedHeaders

        public void configurePinnedHeaders(PinnedHeaderListView listView)
        Description copied from interface: PinnedHeaderListView.PinnedHeaderAdapter
        Configures the pinned headers to match the visible list items. The adapter should call PinnedHeaderListView.setHeaderPinnedAtTop(int, int, boolean), PinnedHeaderListView.setHeaderPinnedAtBottom(int, int, boolean), PinnedHeaderListView.setFadingHeader(int, int, boolean) or PinnedHeaderListView.setHeaderInvisible(int, boolean), for each header that needs to change its position or visibility.
        Specified by:
        configurePinnedHeaders in interface PinnedHeaderListView.PinnedHeaderAdapter

      • getScrollPositionForHeader

        public int getScrollPositionForHeader(int viewIndex)
        Description copied from interface: PinnedHeaderListView.PinnedHeaderAdapter
        Returns the list position to scroll to if the pinned header is touched. Return -1 if the list does not need to be scrolled.
        Specified by:
        getScrollPositionForHeader in interface PinnedHeaderListView.PinnedHeaderAdapter
